thread.title: Manchester City's Draw With Huddersfield Will Cause Mayhem With Fixture List
thread.title_full: Manchester City's Draw With Huddersfield Will Cause Mayhem With Fixture List

title: Manchester City's Draw With Huddersfield Will Cause Mayhem With Fixture List
text:
Manchester City's Draw With Huddersfield Will Cause Mayhem With Fixture List Sat Feb 18 2017 20:12:09   20:12:09 GMT+0000 (GMT) Ryan Sidle Ryan Sidle in football 
On a day of FA Cup shocks we never really expected Manchester City to be one of them, especially in a game that saw no goals scored. Now their replay is set to cause problems. 
Before today only four teams had kept City to a clean sheet. Those were Spurs, Barcelona, Manchester United and Liverpool, with three of those coming back in October. 
Pep Guardiola's team are only bettered by Chelsea in terms of goals scored in the Premier League whilst Huddersfield only have a goal difference on +7 despite being third in the Championship as they don't score too many or concede that few. 
So no one really expected the two sides to play out a 0-0 draw in the FA Cup today. But after they've done that they've caused problems with City's fixture list. 
The date for the replay, due to be in around 10 days, means that they won't be able to play their derby with Manchester United which will now likely be in April as per BBC's Simon Stone Assume Manchester derby now delayed to end of April at earliest. Only 2 midweeks free of Europe, internationals + Prem fixs to end of season - Simon Stone (@sistoney67) February 18, 2017 
The two Manchester clubs were due to play in the league a week tomorrow but with United being in the EFL Cup final next week that game has to be changed. 
There had been no date for it but City's draw guarantees that there's no time to play it any time soon. 
It does beg the question as to why any 'big' matches are scheduled for the same weekend as the EFL Cup final. 
The news will not please Jose Mourinho in his attempts to finish in the top four as United already have to face Chelsea, Arsenal and Spurs in the last few weeks of the season. 
Can United finish in the top four? Sponsored Links
